awd_titl_txt: A Study of the Bone-Prosthesis Interface by Vibrational     Spectroscopy
awd_abstract_narration: This is an application to study spectroscopically the                           mineral coating of composite prosthetic implants.  The                          hypothesis is that the nature of the bone-implant                               interface is determined by the nature of the implant                            surface whether or not the interface is occupied by                             mineralized or non-mineralized tissue.   The hypothesis                         will be tested using animal experiments.  The primary                           tool for surface characterization is Raman spectroscopy;                        spectral resolution will be enhanced by 2nd derivative                          computations.                                                                                                                                                   This study will provide basic information about the                             interface between bone and various calcium mineral                              coatings.  The gained knowledge should be very useful for                       designing optimized mineral coatings for implants.
org_div_long_name: Division of Chemical, Bioengineering, Environmental, and Transport Systems
